The first aggregate is defilement, then what is cognized, form, is there feeling, mind, and world,
Conditioned by the immediately preceding, increasing, severing wholesome defilements,
There are six groups of consciousness, namely eye-consciousness, ear-, nose-, tongue-, body-, and mind-consciousness.

There are six groups of consciousness, namely eye consciousness, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind consciousness.

Eye and form as conditions give rise to eye consciousness. If the blue form is agreeable and pleasant, it distinguishes this blue as agreeable and pleasant. Because of this, it can nourish the faculties and increase the great elements.ğŸ”½Eye and form as conditions give rise to eye consciousness. If the blue form is disagreeable and painful, it distinguishes this blue as disagreeable and painful. Contact, feeling, perception, and thought turn to this blue form as disagreeable and painful. Eye and form as conditions give rise to eye consciousness. If the blue form is neither agreeable nor disagreeable, neither painful nor pleasant, it distinguishes this blue as neither agreeable nor disagreeable, neither painful nor pleasant. Contact, feeling, perception, and thought turn to this blue form as neither agreeable nor disagreeable, neither painful nor pleasant. Because of this, the faculties are neither nourished nor harmed, and the great elements are neither increased nor destroyed.
It is the same with yellow, red, and white colors.

When mind and dharmas are the conditions, they give rise to mental consciousness. If there are dharmas that are disagreeable and painful, one discerns these dharmas as disagreeable and painful. Contact, feeling, perception, and volition regarding these dharmas arise as disagreeable and painful. Because of this, one is able to diminish the faculties and destroy the great elements.

When mind and dharmas are the conditions, they give rise to mental consciousness. If there are dharmas that are neither agreeable nor disagreeable, neither painful nor pleasant, and one discriminates these dharmas as neither agreeable nor disagreeable, neither painful nor pleasant, then the contact, feeling, conceptualization, and mental activities that arise with these dharmas are neither agreeable nor disagreeable, neither painful nor pleasant. Because of this, the faculties are neither nourished nor harmed, and the primary elements are also neither increased nor destroyed.

There are some forms that are visible but not resistant, some forms that are resistant but not visible, some forms that are both visible and resistant, and some forms that are neither visible nor resistant.

Those that are visible but not resistant refer to blue, yellow, red, white, shadow, light, brightness, darkness, and the single visible form of space. This is just like the blue, yellow, red, and white.
Those that are resistant but not visible refer to bodily expressive action.
Those that are both visible and resistant refer to those forms that are both visible and resistant.
Without manifestation and without form refers to if the form has no manifestation and no form.
Can there be a mind belonging to this realm and karma belonging to this realm, and this mind and this karma are the fruits belonging to this realm?
He said:
There is.
For example, a mind belonging to the desire realm and karma belonging to the desire realm, this mind and this karma are the fruits belonging to the desire realm;
A mind belonging to the form and formless realms and karma belonging to the form and formless realms are the fruits belonging to the form and formless realms.
Can there be a mind belonging to this realm and karma belonging to this realm, and this mind and this karma are not the fruits belonging to this realm?
He said:
There is.
For example, a path belonging to the form realm manifests desire realm emanations, manifesting desire realm affairs and speaking desire realm language;
For example, a path belonging to the form and formless realms eliminates the bonds and realizes the fruits.

He said:ğŸ”½For all past feelings, these feelings have all ceased.

Or there are feelings that are not yet arisen, but these feelings are not future, namely those feelings that are definitely to be born in this life.
Are all feelings that are present present in the present?
He said:

Or there are feelings that are present, but these feelings are not present in the present, namely those feelings that have arisen and ceased in this life, and those feelings that are definitely to be born in this life.
